Package controllers

Class LevelController

java.lang.Object
controllers.LevelController
public class LevelController
extends java.lang.Object
Maintains current level and passes level information between the Level model and WorldView. LevelView binds to the currentLevelValue field and fetches boss level from this controller, thus the boss level can be altered in the future purely through this controller. Handles finishing the game (when the boss level is finished) by calling the HomeController.gameOver(String).

    • getBossLevelValue

      public static java.lang.String getBossLevelValue()

    • getCurrentLevelValue

      public static javafx.beans.binding.StringBinding getCurrentLevelValue()
      Returns:
      the changing value of the current level. StringBinding is bound to the view which displays the level. As the level changes, so can the displayed level because of this datatype.

    • getLevelView

      public static LevelView getLevelView()

    • getFirstLevel

      public static Actor[] getFirstLevel()

    • getCurrentLevel

      public static Actor[] getCurrentLevel()

    • getNextLevel

      public static Actor[] getNextLevel()
      Returns:
      an array of Actor which serves as the population for the next level. null if the game is finished, which is handled gracefully by callers. JFX tidying up is only performed if Player.isInitialised() returns true. If Player is not initialised, then this method is being used by its test class.

    • getSpecificLevel

      public static Actor[] getSpecificLevel​(int level)
      Parameters:
      level - the desired level for the game to display
      Returns:
      an array of actors for populating the level Only used for debugging to explicitly set levels (without having to play through them all)
